intro: Bryodesma indicum, commonly known as the Indian moss, is a species of liverwort found in humid tropical regions. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its small, leafy structure. The plant typically grows on moist soil or rock surfaces, thriving in shaded environments. Its reproductive structures are borne on specialized stems called sporophytes. Bryodesma indicum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
